function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Increase in confirmed cases and deaths in specific regions","category":"Person","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Higher occurrence and fatalities in certain countries","category":"Person","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases in the workplace through shared office tools.","category":"Business","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate implementation of covid-19 preparedness and response plans","category":"Organization","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate adherence to basic preventive measures","category":"Person","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of appropriate isolation and reporting of covid-19 cases","category":"Organization","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Restrictions on covid-19 testing by private sector","category":"Organization","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Lack of workplace flexibilities and protections","category":"Organization","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of administrative control measures in the workplace","category":"Organization","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Surge in covid-19 patients requiring space, staff, supplies, and systems to manage capacity","category":"Organization","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate infection control measures during activities with suspected or confirmed cases","category":"Organization","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher risk of covid-19 transmission in healthcare workplaces","category":"Organization","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contact with health care workers caring for covid-19 patients","category":"Person","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of enhanced infection control measures in various activities with suspected or confirmed cases, samples, material, and waste","category":"Organization","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of regular covid-19 infection risk assessment","category":"Organization","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Neglect of green space quality","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Health risks originating from social and physical environments","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Little attention to the quality of green spaces may affect the benefits to people","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of interlinkages on the mental health-wildlife-environment interface in urban green spaces may result in inadequate planning and management.","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exposure to contaminated urban green spaces leading to the spread of contagious diseases","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate waste management in urban green spaces leading to disease transmission","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of proper maintenance leading to the breeding of disease-carrying insects and pests in green spaces","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Incompatibility with the definitions of green space, green space quality, mental health, or wildlife support","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Exclusion of articles based on language english only","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Focus on zoonotic and vector-borne diseases","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Exclusion of articles with limited sampling points to green spaces","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of emphasis on wildlife health capacity in urban environments","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neglecting the environmental dimension and focusing solely on human health","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Non-domestic animals in urban areas impacting human and animal health","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of representation of studies from south america and africa in urban wildlife research","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Concentration of urban wildlife research in europe and north america","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Limited studies assessing multiple animal groups simultaneously","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate wildlife management leading to disease transmission","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Impact of urban matrix on disease transmission","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Trade-offs within animal groups due to grass cover","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Minimizing forest edges and designing trails far from forest patches may reduce wildlife protection and mental health benefits while allowing human immersion in nature.","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Intensive vegetation management for mental health benefits may be detrimental to wildlife, leading to an increase in urban exploiter species.","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Human aesthetic preferences in green spaces may negatively impact urban wildlife support, leading to a potential conflict between human preferences and wildlife habitat needs.","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of dogs in green spaces can disrupt wildlife activity patterns, but walking dogs is a common motivation for people to visit green spaces.","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Management of decorative vegetation can impact wildlife support and the restorative potential of green spaces.","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate management of green spaces may lead to the spread of contagious diseases among humans and animals.","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential transmission of contagious diseases from wildlife to humans in green spaces","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of green space characteristics on human and animal health","category":"Laws&Regulations","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of studies on urban green spaces in developing countries","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Transferability of empirical evidence from developed to developing countries","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-low"},{"name":"Limited access to nature in urban areas leading to reduced restoration and well-being","category":"Visions&Priorities","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Disturbance, fragmentation, and isolation of urban green spaces impacting wildlife
